intro: Warnera, commonly known as the false arrowhead, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araceae. It consists of several species native to tropical regions of the Americas. The plants are characterized by their arrow-shaped leaves and striking, spadix-like inflorescences. Warnera species are often grown as ornamental plants due to their unique foliage and vibrant flowers. They prefer warm, humid environments and are typically found in wetlands or along stream banks.
